intro: Bryonia monoica, commonly known as the white bryony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or disturbed soils. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that give way to orange-red, spiny fruits. Its leaves are heart-shaped with a rough texture, and it has a climbing habit. Bryonia monoica contains toxic compounds, making it potentially harmful if ingested.
